Name: user_name
Description: Name of user type

Name: num_users
Description: Number of users within the resprective user-type

Name: user_preference
Description: Related to cooking behaviour, how many types of meal a user wants a day (number of user preferences has to be defined here and will be further specified with pref_index parameter)

Name: name
Description: Appliance name

Name: number
Description: Number of appliances

Name: power
Description: Power rating of appliance (average)

Name: num_windows
Description: Number of distinct time windows, e.g. if an appliance is running 24 h the num_windows is 1. If num_windows is set to x then you have to fill in the window_x_start, window_x_end and random_var_w parameters)

Name: func_time
Description: Total time an appliance is running in a day (not dependant on windows)

Name: time_fraction_random_variability
Description: For time (not for windows), randomizes the total time the appliance is on

Name: func_cycle
Description: Running time: time the appliance is on (after switching it on)

Name: fixed
Description: All appliances of the same kind (e.g. street lights) are switched on at the same time (if fixed=yes)

Name: fixed_cycle
Description: Number of duty cycle, 0 means continuous power, if not 0 you have to fill the cw (cycle window) parameter (you may define up to 3 cws)

Name: occasional_use
Description: Defines how often the appliance is used, e.g. every second day will be 0.5

Name: flat
Description: no variability in the time of usage, similar to fixed, but does not account for all appliances of the same type at the same time, no, if switched on and off at different times for different days

Name: thermal_p_var
Description: Range of change of the power of the appliance (e.g. shower not taken at same temparature) or for the power of duty cycles (e.g. for a cooker, AC, heater if external temperature is different…)

Name: pref_index
Description: This number must be smaller or equal to the value input in user_preference

Name: wd_we_type
Description: Specify whether the appliance is used only on weekdays (0), weekend (1) or the whole week (2)

Name: p_i1
Description: Power rating for first part of ith duty cycle. Only necessary if fixed_cycle is set to I or greater

Name: t_i1
Description: Duration of first part of ith duty cycle. Only necessary if fixed_cycle is set to I or greater

Name: cwi1_start
Description: Window start time for the first part of ith specific duty cycle number (not neccessarily  linked to the overall time window)

Name: cwi1_end
Description: Window end time for the first part of ith specific duty cycle number (not neccessarily  linked to the overall time window)

Name: p_i2
Description: Power rating for second part of ith duty cycle number. Only necessary if fixed_cycle is set to i or greater

Name: t_i2
Description: Duration second part of ith duty cycle number. Only necessary if fixed_cycle is set to I or greater

Name: cwi2_start
Description: Window start time for the second part of ith duty cycle number (not neccessarily  linked to the overall time window)

Name: cwi2_end
Description: Window end time for the second part of ith duty cycle number (not neccessarily  linked to the overall time window)

Name: r_ci
Description: randomization of the duty cycle parts’ duration. There will be a uniform random variation around t_i1 and t_i2. If this parameter is set to 0.1, then t_i1 and t_i2 will be randomly reassigned between 90% and 110% of their initial value; 0 means no randomisation

Name: window_j_start
Description: Start time of time-window j. Only necessary if num_windows is set to j or greater

Name: window_j_end
Description: End time of time-window j. Only necessary if num_windows is set to j or greater

Name: random_var_w
Description: variability of the windows in percent, the same for all windows
